Dearest Fattu. Vesterday, Sunday. I spent an agreeable day. Theres a young man
who is now Adriser at Baaubah called Caft. Reed. He is a very nice by;
The known him for a long time. But he has fallen into very chtay halter
he never comes to see any of us + from his reepate I had a fully that he
was setting rather out of touch. So I telegraphed announcing that I was coming
to lunch with him hired a motor + started off on a beautiful sharp
sunsheny morning. I got to Baanbah about 11. 30 when the sum was
beginning to be pleasantly not. The place looked charming, hinted in its
orange groves with as s heepy little carnal, the tail of the Khuras an
wandereds through the midst of it. I went straight to the sanci where I
found cast seed + his zarding old Matasanif, Alemad Halat By.
The latter had once called on me but I was out a had at Yet means
his acanaintance. He is a sitttle, courtious old Turkish official of the
best take, conscicntious a honest. It was anite delightful to see
the frieusty intimacy with on him + Capt sed. A you asked
one of them a question he turned to the other for conpirmation ofles
answer. We all three sat in the Matusanmfs office + talked about
Digalah appairs for about half an hour, after which I made my
how say I felt sure he must be vary + that I would wait in
cast Rhed': office till he was ready to so to lunch. That not a bit of
it - the Matasaih hotted after us + sat chattry while Coat
had sorned his letters + then insisted a shewing me all over
the since, part of which was burnt in last years distarbances
And they both bubbled once with a description of the repairs they
intended, to make. So I went with Cabirand to lunch in his
ramoheakte little house wholly ocord of any vectige of comfort.

from Kiyil Robat when the melows and all the time Capt

division + would even spend the night in an Arch text - a they I

They really are wonderful these young Englishmen, all are

I had tea with Faical that afternoon to discuss the founding

Tecterdau, Sunday, I shook myself free + motored out with

8 on a close hot morning - it has been bery list + stufly
there last few days - + a more beautiful sight I son'
think ever saw. The rates are late in ripenng this year +
are still hanging in great coldea crowns on the palins; below

little roop of lianorice stalls. Our lunch was cooled in
the open are - excellent rice + cluchen + stowed meats.
with strained pomegranate quiet to drink - + served to as

Meantime they are setting down to the treaty between the

Faiial has been living in terror, of it; he is a fraid that
